title: Cenk Uygur's Final Judgment: Jon Stewart Leaving The Daily Show

comments.text:
As a Brit, I am so sad to see Jon leaving 'The Daily Show'.
He (his writers and co-hosts) gave non-Americans around the world hope that 
there were a lot of Americans who were prepared to think about a 'Middle 
Way', rather than automaticallly divide along the bi-partisan lines that 
are instilled by the US' two-party electoral system.
I can't think of anyone who can fill his shoes... :(﻿

comments.author: futurejarhead0311

comments.text:
Another political "comedian" off the air. People follow this guy like a 
cult, and yet he's consistently proven himself not even remotely worthy of 
ANY following, let alone a status akin to "political god".

The irony of shows like his, that run on bashing fox news-esque blind 
right-wingers, is that the same shows pander to an equally misinformed and 
biased demographic. Take a few minutes to think over what it really means 
to run a political humor show. Ridiculing the least-intelligent sect of a 
movement, to make the entirety of that movement look bad. Then, via 
exploitation of the confirmation bias, you end up just brainwashing these 
people into blindly accepting whatever is said on your show as truth.

In order to correctly run a political satire show, one must first assume 
that the viewership has at least some political knowledge or interest apart 
from your show. That's not the case though, is it? People get their 
politics from shows like these exclusively. And as wrong as fox news can be 
at points, at least they try and actually have discussions like adults, as 
opposed to pointing and laughing at edited clips (many of which are taken 
out of context) like children. And even if you ARE politically informed 
outside of political satire shows, it's still just intellectually numbing 
material. Indulging in biased media that is as dumbed down as any of the 
major political outlets, will lead to you eventually succumbing (at least 
partially) to the stupidity watching such shows evokes.

What happened to guys like William Buckley? Regardless as to what side of 
the political spectrum you're on, the way he ran his show was THE ONLY WAY 
a show of a political nature should be run. Him at a desk with his 
opponent, discussing the issue at hand. Unedited, unscripted. Often times 
his opponents made him look bad, and vise versa, but that's the nature of 
running a show that consists exclusively of intellectual discourse. It's 
always fun to re-watch some of those shows, they encouraged young people to 
strive for intellectual greatness, to become the next buckley (or the next 
chomsky if you lean left). And it wasn't just Buckley, all politics at the 
time were discussed via mediums such as his, both left and right leaning. 
The only people you saw guys like Stewart debating were bill-o-rielly-esque 
morons who could obviously do nothing but spew right-wing rhetoric, never 
did he bring anyone that even remotely rivaled him intellectually. Not to 
mention the generous amount of editing and scripting that goes into 
comedy-show "debates". HOW THE FUCK HAS IT DEGRADED TO SHIT LIKE THE DAILY 
SHOW AND COLBERT?

RULE 5: “Ridicule is man’s most potent weapon.” There is no defense. It’s 
irrational. It’s infuriating. It also works as a key pressure point to 
force the enemy into concessions.

RULE 12: Pick the target, freeze it, personalize it, and polarize it.” Cut 
off the support network and isolate the target from sympathy. Go after 
people and not institutions; people hurt faster than institutions.

Looks like leftist talking heads have been doing their reading :^)﻿

comments.author: weaseldragon

comments.text:
Am I the only one who is actually kind of glad Jon Stewart is leaving The 
Daily Show? Let's be honest, his show has been collapsing on itself for a 
long time now. From the words of Niche "When you stare into the abyss the 
abyss stares back into you". Think about it, can Jon Stewart really still 
say that he's better than Crossfire? Jon Stewart was once heralded for 
heavily criticizing news media for failing to respect the intelligence of 
their viewers and only creating a great polarization in the country. Now, 
his show has devolved into a mess of complete rhetoric and lack of nuance 
to which many of his audience get their news exclusively from either him, 
or his subordinate Colbert (or now the even less nuanced or talented Larry 
Wilmore) and maybe if you're lucky the excuse for "an interesting look at 
news" that is The Young Turks. I kind of look at The Daily Show the same 
way I look at the Simpsons. Just end the show so we can talk about how 
great the show WAS. To keep Jon Stewart performing would be to put an old 
dog on iron lung. ﻿

drops though, or get out right before. He can probably also see the 
totalitarian heel coming down soon. He'll be missed for making people care 
about (and laugh at) politics. With him gone at least some percentage of 
people will fall out of the loop completely unless someone just as 
entertaining as him comes along.﻿
